name: Stay2a

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had three nights at this little treasure of a b&b in folkstone and really enjoyed it, great service, lovely rooms and great value, clean comfortable and with good breakfasts in a location that makes it easy to get to many other parts of kent, it also helped that Pauls restaurant, over which the bedrooms were situated produce good food in ample quantities on three nights, and no you dont get distrubed by noise from the restaurant, only down side was having to move the car out of the car park before 8.30am each day as its shared, that said it was a very minor issue and had no effect on our enjoyment of staying here, and given that I fell down the stairs within 5 minutes of arriving much to Paul and Pennys concerns, they were soooo helpful, I would certainly stay again
reviews.title: Excellent stay at stay2a

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paul and Penny are lovely hosts who make you feel at home straight away. Everything about the place is spot on and professional, it's no wonder they are so highly rated. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.
reviews.title: Great Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: We are a couple in our 30's and would recommend to anyone! We stayed in Feb and everything about our stay was perfect, from the owners to the rooms,dinner, breakfast, cleanliness. Couldnt find fault in anything . Lovely extra touches like complimentary hot & cold drinks and fruit & biscuits.
reviews.title: Amazing B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are beautifully decorated.
reviews.title: Did not disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pauls restaurant was lovely and the desserts trolly is to die for!!
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique b n b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Stay2a as it had great reviews and it was close enough to walk to Rocksalt which we had booked for a birthday meal.
reviews.title: Lovely Love Letters!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Penny showed us to our room - we stayed in Love Letters Room - it was lovely interior, calm, very comfortable and spotless - loved the ceiling lights! .Enjoyed a laze in the bath too! Complimentary fresh fruit and cold drinks was a nice touch - situated just outside the 3 rooms. There is tea and coffee in your room as well. Great night's sleep and went down for breakast at 9.30am - so no rush, which was really nice. Paul cooked our breakfast which was very nice - I had scrambled egg & salmon, and my partner had full english.
reviews.title: An Absolute Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also bought a homemade gipsy tart (made by Penny) which was, according to my other half, the best he had ever had (I don't eat it) - he ate the whole tart himself within 4 days! He said he would gladly drive 40 mins to Folkestone just to get another one!
reviews.title: Perfect weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay 2a can not be faulted in any way. Upon arrival we were welcomed with a lovely hand written note from Paul. The room was spotless, beautifully and tastefully decorated. Some of the lovely touches are the fruit bowl, coffee and soft drinks which are all complimentary and available 24 hours a day. Access to the accommodation was easy and very secure. The room size was perfect. We dined in 'Pauls' restaurant which is underneath the accommodation. The restaurant has a very warm, welcoming and relaxing atmosphere. Paul took time to welcome us, and ensured that we were well cared for. Paul and his staff took every opportunity to ensure their guests enjoyed a wonderful meal. There was a great choice of food, all very reasonably priced and the food itself was delicious. Breakfast was included in the room tariff, and we were spoilt for choice. Again a fantastic dining experience. We would not hesitate to recommend Stay 2a to anyone, and indeed we look forward to returning again very soon.
reviews.title: best in Folkestone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this B&B for a weekend away with my partner based purely on the reviews and ratings from previous guests and it was absolutely everything they said it would be. Beautifully decorated clean comfy rooms, delicious food and Paul and Penny were so friendly and accommodating, taking the time to talk to us and giving us advice on what to see and do whilst we were there. My partner and I will most definitely be back. A huge thank you to Paul, Penny and their staff for making our weekend away so perfect!
reviews.title: Brilliant Weekend at Stay 2a !
Cracking rooms, great food
reviews.text: An overnight before the tunnel, great rooms and excellent food. The breakfast was wide ranging and very good quality. The dinner was top notch. Rooms are well appointed, newly decorated and contemporary. We would stay again. My only tiny gripe is that the parking is shared with the solicitor next door and not available much before 6pm or after 9am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay 2 a is a lovely place to stay, we stayed in the burlesque room! All very clean and modern. Paul and Penny are lovely hosts make you feel very welcome. The breakfast and evenings meals are brilliant probably the best food we've ever had staying in a hotel, excellent will def be returning.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner B+B and this was the best we have stayed in over 20 years
reviews.title: An overnight stay after the tunnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was really good and the service spot on. The room was contemporary and a real pleasure. We will certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Really lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a find. A lovely, friendly B&B. really well appointed rooms with thoughtful touches & lovely restaurant downstairs where breakfast is served. Walking distance or short cab ride to Rocksalt but next time we go we'll eat in the restaurant!
reviews.title: Best place in area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for the weekend to see friends and see the Red Arrows display. There are 3 rooms - we were in Burlesque so called because of the wallpaper pattern. The room was a good size very well laid out and furnished and the bed very comfortable. It has tea/coffee facilities and a good quality TV with a large range of channels - free wifi good strength also. The breakfast was faultless with choice and quantity to suit even the most discerning palate. We ate in the restaurant below in the evening and had an outstanding meal and a sweet from the sweet trolley - about a dozen choices all home made. Again the quality and amount was very good. The staff were, without exception, polite, well knowledged and helpful.
reviews.title: Just about perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed for 1 night on our way to France and arrived just in time to enjoy a wonderful meal in Paul's Restaurant before our stay in a fantastic room. Paul and Penny were very hospitable and obviously work very hard to achieve the standard they deserve. Will definitely book again!
reviews.title: BRILLIANT PLACE TO STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stay2A looked great on the web as a 'night before' our Eurotunnel journey. When we got there - it was packed, and full of energy downstairs. Upstairs, our boutique style room was just lovely, with lots of little touches that made it a sanctuary. And the small gesture of a welcoming glass of wine - thank you Paul.
reviews.title: An Unexpected Journey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next day was fulsome and individually prepared.
reviews.title: Unfortunate timing ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved it!
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed one night to see family and eat at Paul`s restaurant ( downstairs) and once again were treated to a wonderful experience. Clean and well decorated room with the aforementioned bed. Tea and coffee making equipment and complimentary soft drinks and biscuits and fruit and sweets outside in or near the fridge. Parking is free and the location is right by the main street. Ideal for pre or post ferry breaks or Leas Cliff Hall events. Clive`s wonderful breakfasts are a major highpoint with enough choice for any palate or preference. You dont have to stay to take breakfast.
reviews.title: Love letters - love to have that bed at home
Fantastic place
reviews.text: Only one slight whinge - the wifi must have been having a night off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't fault it - the room (love letters) was spacious, modern and spotless; the welcome warm (liked the complimentary drinks) and the breakfast delicious. We had a great time and will definitely be back. Thanks, Paul and Penny.
reviews.title: Great personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A true gem of a boutique B and B. A genuine friendly welcome from the owners. Nice touches included a welcome hot drink on arrival and complimentary fruit on the landing. Well furnished super modern room and a good night's sleep followed by a great breakfast choice - how often are you offered eggs mornay for breakfast?
reviews.title: An amazing place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is a bit complicated but a minor distraction to a great stay.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great location

description: Stay2a provides stylish “Boutique Hotel” style guest accommodation in the heart of Folkestone, Kent. Choose from three designer themed kingsize ensuite bedrooms offering luxury and individuality. Fully inclusive Bed and Breakfast.
